strategy: Replace the DNN with a random forest ensemble model using gradient-boosted decision trees (e.g., XGBoost or LightGBM) with hyperparameter tuning via Bayesian optimization. Instead of one-hot encoding, apply target encoding for categorical variables with smoothing to reduce noise. Use a recursive feature elimination (RFE) pipeline to select top 50 features based on their contribution to R², then train the ensemble on the selected features. Employ group-based time-based cross-validation to preserve temporal dynamics in training. Monitor out-of-bag R² scores to detect overfitting early.

from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, TimeSeriesSplit, RecursiveFeatureElimination

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, TimeSeriesSplit
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import GradientBoostingRegressor
from sklearn.feature_selection import SelectKBest, f_regression
